Header: The Gazette issued notifying 25 thousand rupees penalty on 7 motor traffic offences
Content: The Gazette imposing a minimum penalty of 25 thousand rupees for 7 traffic offences was issued today Driving without a valid license, drunk driving, and negligence to enter a railway level crossing, driving without a valid insurance, high speed, employing persons without a license to drive vehicles and overtaking by the left are the offenses which are stipulated under this new penalty. The Transport Ministry further said that in addition, the traffic penalty on the offenses such as underage driving, dangerous driving and using a mobile phone while driving will be increased soon.
